clinical_study.brief_title: Impact of Postoperative Telemedicine Visit vs In-person Visit on Patient Satisfaction During the COVID-19 Pandemic: A Prospective Randomized Trial
clinical_study.official_title: Impact of Postoperative Telemedicine Visit vs In-person Visit on Patient Satisfaction During the COVID-19 Pandemic: A Prospective Randomized Trial

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this clinical study is to evaluate whether remote video/audio postoperative visits (telemedicine visits) affects patient satisfaction compared to in-person visits during the COVID-19 pandemic. If the primary objective of the study is achieved, it would allow better understanding of how telemedicine can be integrated into modern surgical practice to take care of postoperative patients.

primary_outcome.description: Patient satisfaction score measured by electronic survey sent to all participating patients after their first postoperative visit

secondary_outcome.description: Patient-reported safety score rated from 1 to 5

secondary_outcome.measure: Patient willingness to recommend provider to peers rated from 1 to 5
secondary_outcome.description: Patient willingness to recommend provider to peers rated from 1 to 5

secondary_outcome.measure: Combined patient satisfaction score from 1st and 2nd postoperative visits
secondary_outcome.description: Combined patient satisfaction score from 1st and 2nd postoperative visits

secondary_outcome.measure: Distance (in kilometers) of patient's primary residence to the clinic location
secondary_outcome.description: Distance (in kilometers) of patient's primary residence to the clinic location

arm_group.description: Patients who will undergo telemedicine visit approximately 1 week postoperatively, then an in-person clinic visit approximately 4 weeks postoperatively
Patients who will undergo in-person clinic visit approximately 1 week postoperatively, then a telemedicine visit approximately 4 weeks postoperatively

intervention.description: A postoperative visit with the patient's surgeon conducted remotely via audio/video smartphone app
A standard-of-care in-person postoperatively visit with the patient's surgeon

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Patients over 18 years of age inclusive at the time of the study who underwent colorectal surgery and are presenting for their first postoperative visit
2. Patients with a computer or phone device with video and audio capabilities
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Children <18 years of age
2. Patients with mental disability
3. Patients without a computer or phone device with video and audio capabilities
4. Patients who require physical intervention during their first postoperative visit (e.g. drain removal, suture removal, staple removal)
5. Patients who are readmitted to the hospital prior to their first postoperative visit will be excluded.
